description: From milk +‎ shed, by analogy with watershed.

entries.meaning: (agriculture, economics) A region producing milk that may be supplied to the area of demand with practical (competitively advantageous) speed and cost of transport.
examples: counties adjoining a large city tended to supply most of its milk before highway and trucking improvements broadened the milkshed

description: From milk +‎ shed, as analogous with woodshed or toolshed.

entries.meaning: A shed in which animals are milked. (Contrast milkhouse, a building or portion thereof where milk is cooled and stored pending transport.)
